page.title: 05THE WESTERHAM FLYER
page.content: For a number of years a railway ran from Westerham to Dunton Green. It was affectionately known as "The Westerham Flyer".The train called at Brasted, Chevening Halt and Dunton Green where passengers could catch trains to London. It was hoped at one time that the line would be extended to Oxted but this did not happen. The line would have gone along what is now South Bank. The line gradually became less well used as more people became car owners. Sir Winston Churchill used the line regularly when he came to Chartwell. The line closed about the time of his death. All that remains today is a road which runs alongside the old line and is known as The Flyers Way.
